TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit UserPermission extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a member of the current form's collection.

remarks.para: The UserPermission class associates a set of permissions for the current form with a single user and an optional expiration date.

Define a user and the permissions associated with that user with the properties of the UserPermission class, and then use one of the methods of the UserPermissionCollection class to add and grant that user permissions on the current form. Use the method of the UserPermission class or the method of the UserPermissionCollection class to remove a user and the user's permissions.

While some permissions granted through the user interface apply to all users, such as printing and expiration date, you can use the UserPermission object to assign them on a per-user basis with per-user expiration dates.

public abstract DateTime ExpirationDate { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.DateTime ExpirationDate
Public MustOverride Property ExpirationDate As DateTime
public: abstract property DateTime ExpirationDate { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };
member this.ExpirationDate : DateTime with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the optional expiration date for the permissions on the current form assigned to the user associated with an instance of the class.
Docs.value: A System.DateTime that represents the expiration date for the user associated with the UserPermission object.

remarks.para: An instance of the UserPermission class associates a set of permissions on the current form with a single user and an optional expiration date. The ExpirationDate property gets or sets the optional expiration date of this UserPermission object using the local time zone.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the specified user from UserPermissionsCollection for the current form, and then displays that user's expiration date.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) UserPermission thisUser = Permission.UserPermissions("someone@example.com") MessageBox.Show(thisUser.ExpirationDate.ToString()) End Sub

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.PermissionType Permission { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.PermissionType Permission
Public MustOverride Property Permission As PermissionType
public: abstract property Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::PermissionType Permission { Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::PermissionType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::PermissionType value); };
member this.Permission : Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.PermissionType with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value representing the permissions on the current form assigned to the user associated with an instance of the class.
Docs.value: One or a combination of constants.

remarks.para: An instance of the UserPermission class associates a set of permissions on the current form with a single user and an optional expiration date. The Permission property gets or sets the set of user permissions specified by this UserPermission object. While some permissions granted through the user interface apply to all users, you can use the UserPermission object to assign them on a per-user basis with per-user expiration dates.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the specified user from UserPermissionsCollection for the current form, and then displays that user's permissions.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) UserPermission thisUser = _ Permission.UserPermissions("someone@example.com") MessageBox.Show(thisUser.Permission.ToString()) End Sub

Docs.summary: Removes the current UserPermission object from the form's permissions.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the specified user from UserPermissionsCollection for the current form, and then removes that user.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) UserPermission thisUser = _ Permission.UserPermissions("someone@example.com") thisUser.Remove()) End Sub

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string UserId { get; }
.property instance string UserId
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property UserId As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ UserId { System::String ^ get(); };
member this.UserId : string

Docs.summary: Gets the e-mail address of the user whose permissions on the current form are determined by the specified object.

remarks.para: An instance of the UserPermission class associates a set of permissions on the current form with a single user and an optional expiration date. The UserId property returns the e-mail address of the user whose permissions are determined by the UserPermission object.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the specified user from UserPermissionsCollection for the current form, and then displays that user's e-mail address.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) MessageBox.Show(Permission.UserPermissions[1].UserId) End Sub
